bibl.title: Telegrams from R.C. Thompson and W.A. O'Connell to John J. Moran, April 15, 1929 and May 13, 1929

div1.p: These telegrams congratulate Moran on receiving the Congressional Medal of Honor.

div1.head: Telegrams from R.C. Thompson and W.A. O'Connell to John J. Moran, April 15, 1929 and May 13, 1929
div1.p:
Form 1289-HV
WESTERN UNION
CABLEGRAMA
NEWCOMB CARLTON, PRESIDENT
J. C. WILLEVER, FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT
__________________________________________________
1929 MAY 13 Recibido en la Habana: Oficina principal: Pi y Margall (Obispo) 49, esquina a Cuba.
CDA621 MEXICO CITY 46
NLT MR JOHN J MORAN=
501
AVE WASHINGTON 36 HAVANA=

MEMBERS ALAN SEAGER POST AMERICAN LEGION GLAD HEAR YOU WERE
AWARDED CONGRESSIONAL MEDAL OF HONOR FOR THE FINE SERVICES YOU
RENDERED THAT WILL NEVER BE FORGOTTEN PLEASE ACCEPT OUR
CONGRATULATIONS AND BEST WISHES=
W A O CONNELL ADJUTANT.

Form 1289-HV
WESTERN UNION
CABLEGRAMA
NEWCOMB CARLTON, PRESIDENT
J. C. WILLEVER, FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT
__________________________________________________
1929 april 15. Recibido en la Habana: Oficina principal: Pi y Margall (Obispo) 49, esquina a Cuba.
CDA907 CD NEWYORK 26 APRIL 15TH
NLT JOHN J MORAN=
768 MAINA 36-40 HAVANA CUBA=

HEARTIEST CONGRATULATIONS CONGRESSIONAL MEDAL SAW STORY FIRST
PAGE YESTERDAY SUNDAY TIMES STOP SPLENDID YOU WIN=
R C THOMPSON.
